title: Insulating the Supreme Court from public opinion

content.question: The judicial branch is designated to be more independent of public opinion than are the legislature or the executive. Yet, The United States Supreme Court rarely deviates too far for too long from prevalent public opinion.(a) Describe two ways in which the United States Supreme Court is insulated from public opinion.(b) Explain how two factors work to keep The United States Supreme Court from deviating too far from public opinion.
